dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright.   He can come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Promise you won't leave him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cross your heart?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cross my heart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What have I got myself into, Ellie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A frog sits next to Carl's glasses. It CROAKS. Carl's hand smacks it like an alarm clock. The frog hops away. Carl rises, looking up at the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The balloons on the house are wilting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He scans the camp.   The bird is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell sits up with a SNORT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dug crazily searches and sniffs, looking for the bird.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dug goes rigid like a pointer dog and "points" to the left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell points to the right.   The bird is on top of Carl's house. Dug turns around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bird has gathered a pile of food on Carl's roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the distance, BABY BIRDS call out.   The bird CALLS back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bird gobbles the food and jumps off the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miles off is a huge grouping of rocks; the LABYRINTH.   The baby birds call from somewhere inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bird "hugs" Russell goodbye and pats Carl on the head with her beak. She HISSES at Dug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The bird hurries off toward the labyrinth.   Carl gathers up the hose tether.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Morning Sweetheart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We better get moving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Huh. Bird's gone. Maybe Russell won't notice. (calls out) Alright, everybody up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's Kevin? He's wandered off! Kevin! Dug, find Kevin!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Find the bird.    Find the bird...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, look! There he is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, that's my food!   Get off my roof!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, get off of his !
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The bird is calling to her babies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Her babies! Kevin's a girl?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Her house is over there in those twisty rocks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She has been gathering food for her babies and must get back to them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait, Kevin's just leaving? But you promised to protect her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Her babies need her, we gotta make sure they're together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry Russell. We've lost enough time already.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The bird rounds a corner and hears rustling in the bushes ahead. She scampers back toward the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell chews on some chocolate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl rolls his eyes and SIGHS. They hear rustling from the bushes behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beta and Gamma, run toward Carl and Russell, viciously barking and growling. Carl protects Russell with his cane. Dug is conflicted. Alpha walks forward and stares menacingly at Carl. He turns toward Dug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alpha BARKS angrily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl and Russell look at Dug.    He turned on them!   Dug shamefully lowers his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gamma and Beta BARK fiercely at Carl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dogs lead Carl and Russell like prisoners.    Dug follows. The house is pulled after them, and on the roof: THE BIRD.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This was her favorite chocolate. Because you sent her away, there's more for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kevin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (high-pitched voice) Where's the bird? You said you had the bird.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, yes. Oh, yes. Since I have said that, I can see how you would think that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, tomorrow. Come back tomorrow and then I will again have the bird. Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You lost it. Why do I not have a surprised feeling? Well, at least you now have lead us to the small mailman and The One Who Smells of Prunes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Master will be most pleased we have found them, and will ask of them many questions. (commanding, to Carl) Come!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait, we're not going with you. We're going to the falls!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get away from me! Get down!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Alpha leads Carl and Russell through a canyon. Dogs patrol the tops of the canyon walls. Four more large dogs join the group.    Carl and Russell watch warily and continue their march. They round a bend.     Before them is a MASSIVE CAVE OPENING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The house and balloon canopy are dwarfed as the group approaches the huge cave opening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: step out of the cave. Carl and Russell stop. More dogs approach from the side. Every way Carl turns there are more dogs! Growling and snarling, the dogs surround Carl and Russell. Closer... closer... From the darkness a voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dogs stop. A figure peers out from the darkness.      It examines Carl, Russell, and the floating house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man laughs.   Carl and Russell laugh along nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dogs LAUGH uproariously at the man's joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The figure walks out toward Carl into the light.   Carl recognizes him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz gives him the "thumbs up."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl GIGGLES with glee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl rushes to shake Muntz's hand.    Muntz is charmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz LAUGHS at his joke.    Carl joins in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dogs CHEER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz walks into the cave. Carl and Russell excitedly follow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Stay!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You came here in that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh... yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In a house? A floating house?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is the darndest thing I've ever seen! You're not after my bird, are you? But if you need to borrow a cup of sugar, I'd be happy to oblige!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, this is all a misunderstanding. My dogs made a mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait, are you Charles Muntz?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well... Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Charles Muntz?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Adventure is out there!"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's really him! (to Russell) That's Charles Muntz!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is?!? (CONSIDERS) Who's Charles Muntz?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes!    It is him! He is!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm Carl Fredricksen. My wife and
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: we were your biggest fans!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you're a man of good taste!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must be tired.     Hungry?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh-huh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to dogs) Attention everyone! These people are no longer intruders. They are our guests.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Follow me! I like you temporarily. You do smell like prunes. I will not bite you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Wow. Carl's eyes adjust to the dark. Muntz's dirigible the "Spirit of Adventure" is tethered in the cave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz gestures to a pylon, where Carl ties off the house. Muntz and the dogs walk up the gangplank of the dirigible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl GIGGLES like a little boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl and Russell follow up the ramp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dug follows, but is blocked by Alpha and Beta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dug WHIMPERS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I'm sorry about the dogs -- hope they weren't too rough on you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) We weren't!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go ahead and moor your airship right next to mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're not actually going inside the "Spirit of Adventure" itself?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh.    Would you like to?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would I?!?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait up, Mr. Muntz!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jiminy Cricket.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do we do with Dug?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He has lost the bird.     Put him in the Cone of Shame.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Alpha, Gamma and Beta walk into the dirigible.   Dug sits forlornly with a PLASTIC CONE around his neck.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I do not like the Cone of Shame.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carl and Russell are speechless as they walk into the room. It's a treasure trove of giant skeletons, stuffed creatures, and rare cultural artifacts. Various servant dogs dust and polish as Muntz leads Carl and Russell through the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dog approaches carrying a menu.    Muntz waves it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz LAUGHS.   Behind him, a dog can't resist gnawing at one of the bones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dog approaches with a bottle of champagne in his mouth. Muntz glances at the bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two dogs work together to remove the cork from the bottle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Most of the collection is housed in the world's top museums: New York, Munich, London... `Course I kept the best for myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you ever! Will you look at that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yes, the Arsinoitherium. Beast charged while I was brushing my teeth. Used my shaving kit to bring him down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, surprise me. (to Carl) Only way to get it out of Ethiopia at the time was to have it declared as "dental equipment!"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my gosh, the Giant Somalian Leopard Tortoise!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, you recognize it? I'm impressed! That's an interesting story there...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hm, excellent choice. (to Carl) I found it on safari with Roosevelt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! They sloppily pour two glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz and Carl LAUGH.   Alpha interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz LAUGHS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He and I fell into a habit of playing gin rummy in the evenings. And did he cheat? Oh, he was horrible!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (high-pitched voice) Master, dinner is ready.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh dear, broken translator.   It's that loose wire again. (leans down, fixes it) There you go big fella.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (deep scary voice) Thank you Master.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I liked his other voice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, dinner is served!    Right this way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Muntz leads Carl and Russell into the dining room and up to a large table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dogs pull back chairs for them.   They sit.   Dog waiters place napkins on their laps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dogs bring out covered plates, look at each other, and remove the silver plate covers at the same time. The meals look delicious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell is served a hot dog.   His waiter can't resist and eats a bite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another dog pours some juice then takes a big slurp from his glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl looks around, still enthralled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gestures toward HIS HOUSE, tethered outside the porthole window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dogs erupt into excited barking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the excitement a dog swipes the rest of Russell's hot dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz picks up a lantern and walks to the back of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lantern illuminates photographs, drawings, samples, feathers. Hundreds of them... all of THE BIRD. Kevin. This is Muntz's obsession. He looks over to a full size skeleton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz is lost in reverie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Distracted Russell finally notices the skeleton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz and Alpha exchange glances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell holds up a chocolate bar to show Muntz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl swipes the chocolate from Russell and pockets it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gone now. Muntz stares. He walks to a table full of flight helmets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Using his cane, Muntz topples a helmet from the table.   It rolls across the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz topples another helmet. He lifts a third to show Carl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drops the helmet.   It rolls to Carl's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl glances around nervously. Out the window, sitting on the roof of his house, sits THE BIRD!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl gets up and pulls Russell from the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl leads Russell toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz follows behind them slowly, menacingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl pulls Russell along, Muntz following behind like something out of a bad dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A distant HAUNTED WAIL.         Everyone stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz walks to the window and looks out.          Atop the roof he sees THE BIRD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns back to Carl... but they're gone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So how are things stateside? Almost tempted to go back a few times, but I have unfinished work here... Please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope you're hungry because Epsilon is the finest chef I've ever had.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Epsilon, you've done it again!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my Ellie would have loved all this. You know, it's because of you she had this dream to come down here and live by Paradise Falls.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm honored. And now you've made it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're sure we're not a bother? I'd hate to impose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No no! It's a pleasure to have guests -- a real treat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Treat?!   Treat! I want a treat!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No no, quiet! Calm down.     Calm down...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shouldn't've used that word... Having guests is a delight. More often I get thieves, come to steal what's rightfully mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They called me a fraud, those... dah! But once I bring back this creature, my name will be cleared.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Beautiful, isn't it? I've spent a lifetime tracking it. Sometimes years go by between sightings... (MORE)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I've tried to smoke it out of that deathly labyrinth where it lives... Can't go in after it. Once in, there's no way out. Lost so many dogs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And here they come, these bandits, and think the bird is theirs to take! But they soon find that this mountain is a very dangerous place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, that looks like Kevin!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Kevin?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah! That's my new giant bird pet. I trained it to follow us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Follow you? Impossible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She likes chocolate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chocolate?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I gave her some of my chocolate. She goes ga-ga for it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But it ran off!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, Carl. These people who pass through here, they all tell pretty good stories. A "Surveyor" making a map.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Botanist" cataloguing plants.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An old man taking his house to Paradise Falls.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the best one yet. I can't wait to hear how it ends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well! It's been a wonderful evening, but we'd better be going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, you're not leaving?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We don't want to take advantage of your hospitality. Come on Russell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But we haven't even had dessert yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, the boy's right. You haven't had dessert. Epsilon here makes a delicious Cherries Jubilee.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, you really must stay. I insist! We have so much more to talk about!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kevin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to dogs) Get them!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carl and Russell untie Carl's house from the pylon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dogs descend down the ramp behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl and Russell run toward the cave opening. Dogs block the cave opening.        Carl stops short.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dug points to a tunnel opening deeper inside the cave.     Carl and Russell run toward him. The cave leads to a steep incline.      The dogs are getting closer. There's no choice but to JUMP. The lift from the overhead balloons allows Carl and Russell to leap down the incline, like astronauts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dogs climb down the rocks, closing in on Carl and Russell. The bird sees the dogs. She jumps off the house and lifts Carl and Russell on her back. She runs through the cave, towing the house behind her. Russell and Carl HANG ON for dear life.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hurry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am hurrying!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're coming!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Master, over here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go toward the light, master!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! Balloons pop as they scrape across the ceiling. The house lowers. Ahead, a giant rock sits in their path. Carl tugs at the house but it CRASHES against the rock, pulling Russell onto the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dragging on the ground, Russell gets BUMPED around badly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Russell!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The dogs close in on Russell. Alpha bites at his heels. Carl fends off Alpha with his cane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alpha is about to bite when an avalanche of boulders rains down! The dogs stop short. Carl looks back as the bird keeps running.      Dug is up on the canyon wall. He caused the avalanche!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will stop the dogs! Dug jumps down to block the path of the approaching dogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dogs run around Dug. Alpha bites Dug by the neck and throws him out of the path. The bird carries Carl, Russell dragging along behind.    She rounds a corner. Russell SWINGS OUT over the abyss. The bird jumps from rock spire to spire.   Russell swings back and forth wildly in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell does the WILDERNESS EXPLORER CALL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl holds out his cane so that Russell can GRAB it and Carl
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get back!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go on Master!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop you dogs!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Help! Help!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gimme your hand!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: him back onto the bird. Meanwhile Dug manages to rejoin his friends, but just in time to reach the end of the line -- A CLIFF EDGE.   A river winds
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: feet below. Carl looks above to see the house's momentum pulling forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl grabs onto Kevin and picks Dug up by the collar. Just as the dogs reach our gang, the house's momentum carries them across the chasm. Alpha bites the bird on the leg but is kicked loose and falls into the river below. Carl LANDS HARD but safely across the river chasm.     The dogs are stuck on the other side. Carl painfully gets up.    He looks up at his house.   It's still intact. He breathes a SIGH OF RELIEF.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bird tries to stand but SQUAWKS pitifully and falls back to the ground. Russell rushes to her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The bird's leg has been injured badly by the dog bite.   She can't stand. Russell applies a bandage. From the distant labyrinth of rocks, the BIRD BABIES call. Kevin CALLS back to them. She tries to stand, but can't. Russell runs to her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl looks at the bird's wounds.   He looks to the rock maze, then to his house. He knows the right thing to do.    And he hates himself for it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hang on to Kevin!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Kevin!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No no no! Kevin! Stay down. (to Carl) She's hurt real bad. Can't we help her get home?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright.   But we've got to hurry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Dripping wet dogs cower in front of a menacing Muntz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz snarls in anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leans over a RADAR TRACKING DEVICE.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You lost them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, it was Dug.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, he's with them.    He helped them escape!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait.   Wait a minute.   Dug...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - CONTINUOUS DUG'S COLLAR SCREEN powers on, and a signal zeroes in on Dug's location.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dug, oblivious, looks out over the landscape, sniffing. Carl and Russell peek out from behind a tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dug scampers back to Carl and Russell, who pull the house from behind a tree canopy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They pull the house, keeping it hidden behind the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The house bumps into a tree, jostling the injured BIRD on the porch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kevin goes back to sleep.    Russell looks at her BANDAGED LEG.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell smiles at the thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks up at Carl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk in silence.   Carl understands. The bird babies CALL OUT in the distance.    Kevin CALLS BACK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell spots the labyrinth, now close by.   He tries to run but is pulled back by his tether.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: See anything?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, my pack is not following us! Boy they are dumb.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is crazy. I finally meet my childhood hero and he's trying to kill us! What a joke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: !   Muntz appears on top of the dirigible with a rifle! A bullet blasts through Carl's balloon strings. A third of them break or shoot skyward. The house plummets, crashing onto the dirigible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Carl is THROWN from the house onto the airship. The house slides toward the edge, Russell, Dug and Kevin still inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl SCRAMBLES to grab the hose trailing from the sliding house. The house slides on to the dirigible's tail fin. Holding the hose, Carl digs in his heels and is just able to stop it. The house teeters on the very edge of the tail fin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell, Dug and Kevin run toward the front porch.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Russell!   Get out of there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: !   A bullet smashes the door jam next to them. Muntz storms toward the house.    Carl holds desperately to the hose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell and others duck inside and slam the door. The house tilts, threatening to tip off at any second.   Carl holds on for his life. Muntz POUNDS on the door with the butt of the rifle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No!    Leave them alone!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Russell, Dug and Kevin back away from the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The house slides farther over the edge. Carl struggles to hold on. The hose caddy is ripping free from the house! The bolts pop from the wooden siding... it's about to go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell, Dug and Kevin run into the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muntz KICKS the door. Suddenly, Carl has an idea.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Russell! Hang on to Kevin! Don't let go of her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Confused, Russell follows Carl's directions.   He Dug and the bird huddle together. Muntz breaks through the door.    He lifts his rifle and sights the bird... Through the window, Carl yells out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kevin!   Chocolate! Carl holds aloft a bar of chocolate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kevin lunges, pushing past Muntz and knocking the rifle from his hands. Muntz lunges after them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hose caddy breaks free. Kevin leaps through the window, Russell and Dug hanging from her side. Muntz leaps after them. But balloon strings tangle around his leg and pull him back. Muntz hangs for a moment... It's thousands of feet from the ground.... He falls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DIRIGIBLE, TOP PANTING, Carl is left holding the hose.   He PULLS himself toward the edge. The hose curves beneath the tail fin.    Finally it swings out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell and Dug dangle from it, sitting on Kevin.     The bird holds on to the hose with her beak. Carl LAUGHS, relieved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russell climbs up, followed by the bird and Dug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl LAUGHS heartily as Dug jumps on him and licks his face. Carl looks into the distance. His house, now empty, floats softly down into the clouds, and disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl smiles.   He puts his arm around Russell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl, Russell, Dug and Kevin stand on the tail of the airship floating off over the clouds.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That was cool!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't jerk around so much, kid!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh I am ready to not be up high.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry about your house, Mr. Fredricksen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, it's just a house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carl and Russell hold and cuddle the baby birds.     The babies peck at Carl's head. Carl and Russell LAUGH.

dialogue.raw_text: Ow! Ow! Ow!

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Time to go.

direction.raw_text: The babies run to the bird.      One stops to HISS at Dug. Carl has misplaced something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just had it here... Kevin starts HACKING.    She COUGHS up the cane. Babies start HACKING too.     They COUGH up tennis balls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little gift from me to you. The bird family enters the labyrinth.     Carl and Russell wave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bird looks back toward Carl and Russell and CALLS OUT one last time before disappearing into the mist.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Awwww!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish I could keep one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Huh, where's my cane?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know what? Keep `em.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bye Kevin!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ready!

direction.raw_text: ...and by receiving their badges, the following Explorers will graduate to Senior Explorers. Each Junior Wilderness Explorer stands next to his father. As the Camp Master announces the achievement he hands the father a badge, who pins it to his son's sash.

direction.raw_text: Russell is tanned and dirty.   And alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl takes his place next to Russell.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl pins the badge onto the missing spot on Russell's sash. It's Ellie's GRAPE SODA PIN.

direction.raw_text: Carl smiles. They salute each other.      Russell gives Carl a hug.   Carl returns it. Russell's mom sits in the audience with Dug.     Russell proudly shows her the badge.

direction.raw_text: The Camp Master leads the audience in the WILDERNESS EXPLORER CALL. Muntz's dogs sit in the back, BARKING in approval.

dialogue.raw_text: For Extreme Mountaineering Lore... Congratulations, Jimmy. (hands badge to dad) For Wild Animal Defensive Arts... Congratulations, Brandon. (hands badge) For Assisting the Elderly...

dialogue.raw_text: Congratulations, Russell. Sir...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Russell, for assisting the elderly, and for performing above and beyond the call of duty, I would like to award you the highest honor I can bestow: The Ellie Badge.

dialogue.raw_text: Alright, I think that covers everybody... So let's give a big Explorer Call to our brand new Senior Wilderness Explorers! Ready everybody?
